TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit XmlReader extends System.Object implements class System.IDisposable
Public MustInherit Class XmlReader Implements IDisposable
public ref class XmlReader abstract : IDisposable

summary.span: 表示提供对 XML 数据进行快速、非缓存、只进访问的读取器。

span.span: Represents a reader that provides fast, noncached, forward-only access to XML data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 提供对 adocument 或流中的 XML 数据的只进、 只读访问。 provides forward-only, read-only access to XML data in adocument or stream. 此类符合 W3C[可扩展标记语言 (XML) 1.0 （第四个版本）](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/)和[在 XML 1.0 中的命名空间 （第三版）](http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/)建议。This class conforms to the W3C [Extensible Markup Language (XML) 1.0 (fourth edition)](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/) and the [Namespaces in XML 1.0 (third edition)](http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-xml-names/) recommendations. 方法使你遍历 XML 数据并读取的节点内容。 methods let you move through XML data and read the contents of a node. 类的属性反映的是读取器位于的当前节点的值。属性值指示的 XML 读取器的当前状态。The properties of the class reflect the value of the current node, which is where the reader is positioned.The property value indicates the current state of the XML reader. 例如，将属性设置为通过方法和通过方法。For example, the property is set to by the method and by the method. 此外提供了数据一致性检查和对 DTD 或架构验证。 also provides data conformance checks and validation against a DTD or schema. 使用请求模型检索数据。 uses a pull model to retrieve data. 此模型中：This model: - 自然，自上而下的过程优化，从而简化状态管理。Simplifies state management by a natural, top-down procedural refinement. - 支持多个输入的流和分层。Supports multiple input streams and layering. - 使客户端为分析器提供字符串直接写入，并因此避免额外字符串复制到其中的缓冲区。Enables the client to give the parser a buffer into which the string is directly written, and thus avoids the necessity of an extra string copy. - 支持有选择地处理。Supports selective processing. 客户端可以跳过的项目，并处理那些感兴趣的应用程序。The client can skip items and process those that are of interest to the application. 你还可以设置属性提前以管理如何将 XML 流处理 （例如，规范化）。You can also set properties in advance to manage how the XML stream is processed (for example, normalization). 本节内容：In this section: [创建 XML 读取器](#xmlreader_create) [Creating an XML reader](#xmlreader_create) [验证 XML 数据](#xmlreader_validate) [Validating XML data](#xmlreader_validate) [数据一致性](#xmlreader_data) [Data conformance](#xmlreader_data) [在节点中导航](#xmlreader_nodes) [Navigating through nodes](#xmlreader_nodes) [读取 XML 元素](#xmlreader_elements) [Reading XML elements](#xmlreader_elements) [读取 XML 属性](#xmlreader_attributes) [Reading XML attributes](#xmlreader_attributes) [读取 XML 内容](#xmlreader_content) [Reading XML content](#xmlreader_content) [将转换为 CLR 类型](#xmlreader_clr) [Converting to CLR types](#xmlreader_clr) [异步编程](#xmlreader_async) [Asynchronous programming](#xmlreader_async) [安全注意事项Security considerations](#xmlreader_security) ## 创建 XML 读取器Creating an XML reader 使用方法来创建实例。Use the method to create an instance. 虽然.NET Framework 提供的具体实现，但类，如， ，和类，我们建议你仅在这些方案中使用的专用的类：Although the .NET Framework provides concrete implementations of the class, such as the , , and the classes, we recommend that you use the specialized classes only in these scenarios: - 当你要从 readan XML DOM 子树对象，请使用类。When you want to readan XML DOM subtree from an object, use the class. （但是，此类不支持 DTD 或架构验证。）(However, this class doesn't support DTD or schema validation.) - 如果必须扩展上请求的实体，你不希望你的文本内容规范化，或者你不希望默认返回属性，请使用类。If you must expand entities on request, you don't want your text content normalized, or you don't want default attributes returned, use the class. 若要指定的要在 XML 读取器上启用的功能集，请将传递对象传递给方法。To specify the set of features you want to enable on the XML reader, pass an object to the method. 你可以使用单个要使用相同的功能，创建多个读取器的对象或修改要使用不同的功能集创建新的读取器对象。You can use a single object to create multiple readers with the same functionality, or modify the object to create a new reader with a different set of features. 你可以还轻松添加到现有的读取器的功能。You can also easily add features to an existing reader. 如果不使用对象，则使用默认设置。If you don't use a object, default settings are used. 请参阅引用页面了解详细信息。See the reference page for details. 引发的 XML 分析错误。 throws an on XML parse errors. 引发异常后，读取器的状态不是可预测的。After an exception is thrown, the state of the reader is not predictable. 例如，报告的节点类型可能不同于当前节点的实际节点类型。For example, the reported node type may be different from the actual node type of the current node. 使用属性检查是否在读取器处于错误状态。Use the property to check whether the reader is in error state. ## 验证 XML 数据Validating XML data 若要定义的 XML 文档及其元素关系、 数据类型和内容约束的结构，你使用文档类型定义 (DTD) 或 XML 架构定义语言 (XSD) 架构。To define the structure of an XML document and its element relationships, data types, and content constraints, you use a document type definition (DTD) or XML Schema definition language (XSD) schema. XML 文档被视为是正确如果它满足定义的所有语法要求[W3C XML 1.0 建议](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/)。An XML document is considered to be well formed if it meets all the syntactical requirements defined by the [W3C XML 1.0 Recommendation](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/). 如果它的格式正确并且也符合其 DTD 或架构定义的约束，则会被视为有效。It's considered valid if it's well formed and also conforms to the constraints defined by its DTD or schema. (请参阅[W3C XML 架构第 1 部分： 结构](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-1/)和[W3C XML 架构第 2 部分： 数据类型](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/)建议。)因此，虽然所有有效的 XML 文档都是格式正确的，但并不是所有格式正确的 XML 文档都是有效的。(See the [W3C XML Schema Part 1: Structures](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-1/) and the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/)recommendations.) Therefore, although all valid XML documents are well formed, not all well-formed XML documents are valid. 你可以验证对 DTD，内联 XSD 架构的数据或 XSD 架构存储在对象 （缓存）; 这些方案如下所述上引用页。You can validate the data against a DTD, an inline XSD Schema, or an XSD Schema stored in an object (a cache); these scenarios are described on the reference page. 不支持 XML 数据简化 (XDR) 架构验证。 doesn't support XML-Data Reduced (XDR) schema validation. 在使用以下设置类指定哪种类型的验证，如果有的话，实例支持。You use the following settings on the class to specify what type of validation, if any, the instance supports. |使用此成员Use this member|若要指定To specify| |-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|----------------| | 属性 property|是否允许 DTD 处理。Whether to allow DTD processing. 默认设置为不允许 DTD 处理。The default is to disallow DTD processing.| | 属性 property|读取器是否应验证数据，以及要执行 （DTD 或架构） 的验证类型。Whether the reader should validate data, and what type of validation to perform (DTD or schema). 默认设置为无数据验证。The default is no data validation.| |事件 event|事件处理程序接收有关验证事件的信息。An event handler for receiving information about validation events. 如果未提供事件处理程序，在出现第一个验证错误时将引发 。If an event handler is not provided, an is thrown on the first validation error.| | 属性 property|其他验证选项通过枚举成员：Additional validation options through the enumeration members:

- `AllowXmlAttributes`-允许 XML 属性 (`xml:*`) 在实例文档，即使它们在架构中未定义中。- `AllowXmlAttributes`-- Allow XML attributes (`xml:*`) in instance documents even when they're not defined in the schema. 属性进行验证基于其数据类型。请参阅设置以在特定方案中使用的引用页。The attributes are validated based on their data type.See the reference page for the setting to use in specific scenarios. （默认情况下禁用）。(Disabled by default.)
- `ProcessIdentityConstraints` -处理的标识约束 (`xs:ID`， `xs:IDREF`， `xs:key`， `xs:keyref`， `xs:unique`) 在验证期间遇到。- `ProcessIdentityConstraints` --Process identity constraints (`xs:ID`, `xs:IDREF`, `xs:key`, `xs:keyref`, `xs:unique`) encountered during validation. （默认情况下启用）。(Enabled by default.)
- `ProcessSchemaLocation` -处理指定的架构`xsi:schemaLocation`或`xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation`属性。- `ProcessSchemaLocation` --Process schemas specified by the `xsi:schemaLocation` or `xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation` attribute. （默认情况下启用）。(Enabled by default.)
- `ProcessInlineSchema`-在验证过程中处理内联 XML 架构。- `ProcessInlineSchema`-- Process inline XML Schemas during validation. （默认情况下禁用）。(Disabled by default.)
- `ReportValidationWarnings`-如果发生验证警告，则报告事件。- `ReportValidationWarnings`--Report events if a validation warning occurs. 如果没有验证特定元素或属性时所依据的 DTD 或 XML 架构，通常会发出警告。A warning is typically issued when there is no DTD or XML Schema to validate a particular element or attribute against. 用于通知。The is used for notification. （默认情况下禁用）。(Disabled by default.)| ||用于验证的 。The to use for validation.| | 属性 property|解析和访问外部资源。The for resolving and accessing external resources. 这可以包括如 DTD 和架构，以及任何外部实体`xs:include`或`xs:import`XML 架构中包含的元素。This can include external entities such as DTD and schemas, and any `xs:include` or `xs:import` elements contained in the XML Schema. 如果没有指定、使用默认使用没有用户凭据。If you don't specify an , the uses a default with no user credentials.| ## 数据一致性Data conformance 通过创建的 XML 读取器methodmeet 以下的法规遵从性要求，默认情况下：XML readers that are created by the methodmeet the following compliance requirements by default: - 新行和属性值进行规范化根据 W3C [XML 1.0 建议](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/)。New lines and attribute value are normalized according to the W3C [XML 1.0 Recommendation](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/). - 自动展开所有实体。All entities are automatically expanded. - 始终添加文档类型定义中声明的默认属性，即使不会验证读取器也是如此。Default attributes declared in the document type definition are always added even when the reader doesn't validate. - 允许的 XML 前缀映射到正确的 XML 命名空间 URI 的声明。Declaration of XML prefix mapped to the correct XML namespace URI is allowed. - 在一次的表示法名称`NotationType`特性声明和`NmTokens`在单个`Enumeration`属性 declarationare 不同。The notation names in a single `NotationType` attribute declaration and`NmTokens` in a single `Enumeration` attribute declarationare distinct. 使用这些属性以指定类型的一致性检查你想要启用：Use these properties to specify the type of conformance checks you want to enable: |使用此属性Use this property|到To|默认Default| |-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------|-------------| | 属性 property|启用或禁用的以下检查：Enable or disable checks for the following:

-字符都是合法的 XML 字符，范围内，定义[2.2 字符](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#charsets)W3C XML 1.0 建议的部分。- Characters are within the range of legal XML characters, as defined by the [2.2 Characters](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#charsets) section of the W3C XML 1.0 Recommendation.
的按照定义所有 XML 名称都是否有效， [2.3 常见语法构造](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#NT-Name)W3C XML 1.0 建议的部分。- All XML names are valid, as defined by the [2.3 Common Syntactic Constructs](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#NT-Name) section of the W3C XML 1.0 Recommendation.

当此属性设置为`true`（默认值）、如果 XML 文件包含非法字符或无效的 XML 名称将引发异常 （例如，元素名称与大量开始）。When this property is set to `true` (default), an exception is thrown if the XML file contains illegal characters or invalid XML names (for example, an element name starts with a number).|启用的字符和名称检查。Character and name checking is enabled.

将 设置为 `false` 会禁用对字符实体引用的字符检查。Setting to `false` turns off character checking for character entity references. 如果读取器正在处理文本数据时，它始终会检查 XML 名称是否有效，而不考虑此设置。If the reader is processing text data, it always checks that XML names are valid, regardless of this setting. **注意：**存在 DTD 时，XML 1.0 建议要求文档级别的一致性。**Note:** The XML 1.0 recommendation requires document-level conformance when a DTD is present. 因此，如果读取器配置为支持，但 XML 数据包含文档类型定义 (DTD)引发。Therefore, if the reader is configured to support , but the XML data contains a document type definition (DTD), an is thrown.| | 属性 property|选择强制执行的一致性的级别：Choose the level of conformance to enforce:

- .- . 符合的规则[格式良好的 XML 1.0 文档](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#sec-well-formed)。Conforms to the rules for a [well-formed XML 1.0 document](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#sec-well-formed).
- .- . 可以使用作为格式良好的文档片段的规则符合[外部分析实体](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#wf-entities)。Conforms to the rules for a well-formed document fragment that can be consumed as an [external parsed entity](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#wf-entities).
- .- . 符合决定读取器的级别。Conforms to the level decided by the reader.

如果数据不符合规则，在引发异常。If the data isn't in conformance, an exception is thrown.|| ## 在节点中导航Navigating through nodes 当前节点是 XML 读取器当前定位在其的 XML 节点。The current node is the XML node on which the XML reader is currently positioned. 所有方法执行与此节点和所有相关的操作属性反映当前节点的值。All methods perform operations in relation to this node, and all properties reflect the value of the current node. 以下方法使易于导航节点和分析数据。The following methods make it easy to navigate through nodes and parse data. |使用此方法Use this method|到To| |-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------| ||读取的第一个节点，并一次前进流一个节点。Read the first node, and advance through the stream one node at a time. 此类调用通常都执行内部`while`循环。Such calls are typically performed inside a `while` loop.

使用属性以获取当前节点的类型 （例如，属性、 注释、 元素和等等）。Use the property to get the type (for example, attribute, comment, element, and so on) of the current node.| ||跳过当前节点的子级，并移到下一个节点。Skip the children of the current node and move to the next node.| | 和 and |跳过非内容节点并将移到下一个内容节点或文件的末尾。Skip non-content nodes and move to the next content node or to the end of the file.

非内容节点包括， ， ， ，和。Non-content nodes include , , , , and .

内容节点包含非空白文本， ，和。Content nodes include non-white space text, , , and .| ||读取元素及其所有子级，并返回一个新实例设置为。Read an element and all its children, and return a new instance set to .

此方法可用于创建在 XML 元素; 周围的边界例如，如果你想要将数据传递给另一个组件进行处理，并且你想要限制的数据量可以访问该组件。This method is useful for creating boundaries around XML elements; for example, if you want to pass data to another component for processing and you want to limit how much of your data the component can access.| 请参阅举例说明一次在文本流的一个节点中导航和显示每个节点的类型的引用页。See the reference page for an example of navigating through a text stream one node at a time and displaying the type of each node. 下列各节描述了如何可以读取特定类型的数据，如元素、 属性和类型化数据。The following sections describe how you can read specific types of data, such as elements, attributes, and typed data. ## 读取 XML 元素Reading XML elements 下表列出的方法和属性，类提供用于处理元素。The following table lists the methods and properties that the class provides for processing elements. 在 置于某个元素上之后，节点属性（例如 ）将反映元素的值。After the is positioned on an element, the node properties, such as , reflect the element values. 除了下面所述的成员之外， 类的任何常规方法和属性也可以用于处理元素。In addition to the members described below, any of the general methods and properties of the class can also be used to process elements. 例如，可以使用 方法读取元素的内容。For example, you can use the method to read the contents of an element. > [!NOTE] > 请参阅第 3.1 节的[W3C XML 1.0 建议](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#sec-starttags)有关的开始标记的定义，结束标记和空元素标记。See section 3.1 of the [W3C XML 1.0 Recommendation](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#sec-starttags) for definitions of start tags, end tags, and empty element tags. |使用此成员Use this member|到To| |---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------| | 方法 method|检查当前节点是否是开始标记还是空元素标记。Check if the current node is a start tag or an empty element tag.| | 方法 method|检查当前节点是元素，并使读取器前进到下一个节点 (调用跟)。Check that the current node is an element and advance the reader to the next node (calls followed by ).| | 方法 method|请检查当前节点为结束标记，使读取器前进到下一个节点。Check that the current node is an end tag and advance the reader to the next node.| | 方法 method|读取纯文本元素。Read a text-only element.| | 方法 method|使 XML 读取器前进到下一个具有指定的名称的子代 （子级） 元素。Advance the XML reader to the next descendant (child) element that has the specified name.| | 方法 method|向前移动到具有指定的名称的下一个同级元素的 XML 读取器。Advance the XML reader to the next sibling element that has the specified name.| | 属性 property|检查当前元素是否有结束元素标记。Check if the current element has an end element tag. 例如:For example:

- `` (是`true`。)- `` ( is `true`.)
- ` ` (是`false`，尽管该元素的内容为空。)- ` ` ( is `false`, although the element's content is empty.)| 读取元素的文本内容的示例，请参阅方法。For an example of reading the text content of elements, see the method. 下面的示例通过处理元素`while`循环。The following example processes elements by using a `while` loop. [!code-csharp[XmlReaderBasic#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/CS/XmlReader_Basic.cs#10)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderBasic#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/VB/xmlreader_basic.vb#10)] ## 读取 XML 属性Reading XML attributes XML 属性最常见的元素，但它们还允许在 XML 声明和文档类型节点上。XML attributes are most commonly found on elements, but they're also allowed on XML declaration and document type nodes. 当定位在元素节点上，方法使你可以通过该元素的属性列表。When positioned on an element node, the method lets you go through the attribute list of the element. 请注意，之后已调用节点属性如， ，和反映该属性的属性、 不是属性的元素的属性属于。Note that after has been called, node properties such as , , and reflect the properties of that attribute, not the properties of the element the attribute belongs to. 类提供这些方法和属性，以读取和处理的元素的属性。The class provides these methods and properties to read and process attributes on elements. |使用此成员Use this member|到To| |---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------| | 属性 property|检查当前节点是否有任何属性。Check whether the current node has any attributes.| | 属性 property|获取当前元素的属性数。Get the number of attributes on the current element.| | 方法 method|将移到元素中的第一个属性。Move to the first attribute in an element.| | 方法 method|将移到下一个属性元素中。Move to the next attribute in an element.| | 方法 method|将移动到指定的属性。Move to a specified attribute.| | 方法或属性 method or property|获取指定属性的值。Get the value of a specified attribute.| | 属性 property|检查当前节点是否是从 DTD 或架构中定义的默认值生成的属性。Check whether the current node is an attribute that was generated from the default value defined in the DTD or schema.| | 方法 method|将移动到拥有当前属性的元素。Move to the element that owns the current attribute. 使用此方法在其属性导航后返回到该元素。Use this method to return to an element after navigating through its attributes.| | 方法 method|将属性值分析为一个或多个`Text`， `EntityReference`，或`EndEntity`节点。Parse the attribute value into one or more `Text`, `EntityReference`, or `EndEntity` nodes.| 任何常规的 方法和属性也可以用于处理属性。Any of the general methods and properties can also be used to process attributes. 例如，在 位于某个属性上之后， 和 属性将反映该属性的值。For example, after the is positioned on an attribute, the and properties reflect the values of the attribute. 也可以使用任何内容 `Read` 方法来获取属性的值。You can also use any of the content `Read` methods to get the value of the attribute. 此示例使用属性来定位在元素上的所有属性。This example uses the property to navigate through all the attributes on an element. [!code-csharp[XmlReaderBasic#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/CS/XmlReader_Basic.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderBasic#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/VB/xmlreader_basic.vb#1)] 此示例使用中的方法`while`循环访问的属性导航。This example uses the method in a `while` loop to navigate through the attributes. (若要返回 CLR 类型，请参阅[下一节](#xmlreader_clr)。)(To return CLR types, see the [next section](#xmlreader_clr).) |使用此成员Use this member|到To| |---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|--------| | 属性 property|获取当前节点的文本内容。Get the text content of the current node. 返回的值取决于节点类型;请参阅引用页面了解详细信息。The value returned depends on the node type; see the reference page for details.| | 方法 method|字符串形式获取的元素或文本节点的内容。Get the content of an element or text node as a string. 此方法将停止处理指令和注释。This method stops on processing instructions and comments.

values as common language runtime (CLR) types instead of strings. 这些成员，可以是最适合你的编码任务而无需手动分析或转换字符串值的表示形式获取值。These members enable you to get values in the representation that is most appropriate for your coding task without having to manually parse or convert string values. - **ReadElementContentAs**只能在元素节点类型上调用方法。The **ReadElementContentAs** methods can only be called on element node types. 这些方法不能在包含子元素或混合内容的元素上使用。These methods cannot be used on elements that contain child elements or mixed content. 在调用时， 对象读取开始标记，读取元素内容，然后移过结束元素标记。When called, the object reads the start tag, reads the element content, and then moves past the end element tag. 将忽略处理指令和注释并展开实体。Processing instructions and comments are ignored and entities are expanded. - **ReadContentAs**方法读取位于读取器当前位置的文本内容和如果 XML 数据没有任何架构或数据类型信息与之关联，将文本内容转换为所请求的返回类型。The **ReadContentAs**methods read the text content at the current reader position, and if the XML data doesn't have any schema or data type information associated with it, convert the text content to the requested return type. 文本、空白、有效空白和 CDATA 节串联在一起。Text, white space, significant white space and CDATA sections are concatenated. 跳过注释和处理指令，而实体引用自动解决。Comments and processing instructions are skipped, and entity references are automatically resolved. 类使用定义的规则[W3C XML 架构第 2 部分： 数据类型](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/)建议。The class uses the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlschema-2/)recommendation. |使用此方法Use this method|返回此 CLR 类型To return this CLR type| property. 请参阅[System.Xml 类中的类型支持](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md)映射信息。See [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md) for mapping information.| 如果元素不能轻松地转换为 CLR 类型由于其格式，因此，你可以使用架构映射以确保成功的转换。If an element can't easily be converted to a CLR following when working with the class: - 从引发的异常可能会泄露冒泡到你的应用程序可能不想的路径信息。Exceptions thrown from the can disclose path information that you might not want bubbled up to your app. 你的应用必须捕获异常并进行相应的处理。Your app must catch exceptions and process them appropriately. - 不要启用 DTD 处理，如果你担心拒绝服务问题或正在处理不可信的源。Do not enable DTD processing if you're concerned about denial of service issues or if you're dealing with untrusted sources. 对于默认禁用 DTD 处理创建的对象方法。DTD processing is disabled by default for objects created by the method. 如果启用了 DTD 处理，可以使用 限制 可以访问的资源。If you have DTD processing enabled, you can use the to restrict the resources that the can access. 你还可以设计您的应用程序，以使 XML 处理受内存和时间的约束。You can also design your app so that the XML processing is memory and time constrained. 例如，你可以在 ASP.NET 应用程序中配置超时限制。For example, you can configure time-out limits in your ASP.NET app. - XML 数据可以包含对外部资源（例如架构文件）的引用。XML data can include references to external resources such as a schema file. 默认情况下，通过使用解析外部资源使用没有用户凭据的对象。By default, external resources are resolved by using an object with no user credentials. 通过执行下列操作之一，可以使此操作更加安全：You can secure this further by doing one of the following: - 通过将 属性设置为 对象限制 可访问的资源。Restrict the resources that the can access by setting the property to an object. - 通过将 属性设置为 ，不允许 `null` 打开任何外部资源。Do not allow the to open any external resources by setting the property to `null`. - 和验证标志对象不默认设置。The and validation flags of an object aren't set by default. 这样，在处理来自不可信的源的 XML 数据时，可以帮助防止 受到基于架构的攻击。This helps to protect the against schema-based attacks when it is processing XML data from an untrusted source. 设置了这些标志后， 对象的 用于在 中解析实例文档中遇到的架构位置。When these flags are set, the of the object is used to resolve schema locations encountered in the instance document in the . 如果属性设置为`null`，架构位置不解析即使和设置验证标志。If the property is set to `null`, schema locations aren't resolved even if the and validation flags are set. 在验证过程中添加的架构会添加新类型，并且可能更改被验证的文档的验证结果。Schemas added during validation add new types and can change the validation outcome of the document being validated. 因此，只应从可信的源解析外部架构。As a result, external schemas should only be resolved from trusted sources. 我们建议禁用标志时验证高可用性方案中，针对文档的大部分内容都有标识约束的架构中的不可信的大型 XML 文档。We recommend disabling the flag when validating untrusted, large XML documents in high availability scenarios against a schema that has identity constraints over a large part of the document. 默认情况下启用此标志。This flag is enabled by default. - XML 数据可以包含大量属性、命名空间声明、嵌套元素等，需要大量的时间来处理。XML data can contain a large number of attributes, namespace declarations, nested elements and so on that require a substantial amount of time to process. 将发送到的输入的大小限制，你可以：To limit the size of the input that is sent to the , you can: - 通过设置限制的文档大小属性。Limit the size of the document by setting the property. - 通过设置扩展实体产生的字符数限制属性。Limit the number of characters that result from expanding entities by setting the property. - 创建自定义`IStream`实现。Create a custom `IStream` implementation for the . - 方法可以用于处理大型数据流。The method can be used to handle large streams of data. 此方法一次读取少量的字符，而不是为整个值分配单个字符串。This method reads a small number of characters at a time instead of allocating a single string for the whole value. - 在读取 XML 文档具有大量唯一的本地名称、 命名空间或前缀时，可能出现的问题。When reading an XML document with a large number of unique local names, namespaces, or prefixes, a problem can occur. 如果你使用的派生自的类，并且你调用， ，或每个项的属性，则返回的字符串添加到。If you are using a class that derives from , and you call the , , or property for each item, the returned string is added to a . 包含的集合的大小，创建字符串句柄的虚拟内存泄漏绝不会减小。The collection held by the never decreases in size, creating a virtual memory leak of the string handles. 有关这一种解决方法是派生自类，并强制实施最大大小配额。One mitigation for this is to derive from the class and enforce a maximum size quota. (没有方法以防止使用，或切换已满时)。(There is no way to prevent the use of a , or to switch the when it is full). 另一种缓解是避免使用所提到的属性，并改为使用方法替换方法尽可能; 这些方法不返回的字符串，并因此避免过度填充问题集合。Another mitigation is to avoid using the properties mentioned and instead use the method with the method where possible; those methods don't return strings and thus avoid the problem of overfilling the collection. - 对象可以包含敏感信息，例如用户凭据。 objects can contain sensitive information such as user credentials. 不可信的组件可能会使用 对象及其用户凭据来创建 对象，以读取数据。An untrusted component could use the object and its user credentials to create objects to read data. 缓存时要小心对象，或传递时到另一个组件中的对象。Be careful when caching objects, or when passing the object from one component to another. - 不接受来自不可信的源的支持组件，例如 、 和 对象。Do not accept supporting components, such as , , and objects, from an untrusted source. ## Examples 下面的代码示例演示如何使用异步 API 来分析 XML。The following example code shows how to use the asynchronous API to parse XML. remarks.format:
## Remarks 大部分重载包括`settings`接受参数对象。Most of the overloads include a `settings` parameter that accepts an object. 你可以使用为此对象：You can use this object to: - 指定你希望在上受支持的功能对象。Specify which features you want supported on the object. - 重用对象以创建多个读取器。Reuse the object to create multiple readers. 可以使用相同的设置创建多个具有相同功能的读取器。You can use the same settings to create multiple readers with the same functionality. 或者，你可以在修改设置实例，并使用不同的功能集创建新的读取器。Or, you can modify the settings on an instance and create a new reader with a different set of features. - 将功能添加到现有的 XML 读取器。Add features to an existing XML reader. 方法可以接受其他 对象。The method can accept another object. 基础对象可以是用户定义的读取器对象，或另一个你想要添加到的其他功能的实例。The underlying object can be a user-defined reader, a object, or another instance that you want to add additional features to. - 充分利用功能，例如更好的一致性检查和法规遵从性到[XML 1.0 （第四个版本）](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/)仅在可用的建议创建的静态对象方法。Take full advantage of features such as better conformance checking and compliance to the [XML 1.0 (fourth edition)](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/)recommendation that are available only on objects created by the static method. > [!NOTE] > 尽管.NET Framework 包括的具体实现类，如， ，和类，我们建议你创建实例使用方法。Although the .NET Framework includes concrete implementations of the class, such as the , , and the classes, we recommend that you create instances by using the method. ## 默认设置Default settings 如果你使用不接受的重载对象，将使用以下默认读取器设置：If you use a overload that doesn't accept a object, the following default reader settings are used: |设置Setting|默认Default| |-------------|-------------| ||`true`| ||| ||`false`| ||`false`| ||`false`| ||00| ||00| ||`null`| ||| ||空的 对象An empty object| || 启用 enabled| ||| ||一个新 对象。A new object. 从.NET Framework 4.5.2 开始，此设置不会产生的默认值为`null`。Starting with the .NET Framework 4.5.2, this setting has a default value of `null`.| ## 有关常见方案的设置Settings for common scenarios 以下是属性应设置为一些典型的 XML 读取器方案。Here are the properties you should set for some of the typical XML reader scenarios. |需求Requirement|SetSet| |-----------------|---------| |数据必须是格式良好的 XML 文档。Data must be a well-formed XML document.| 到。 to .| |数据必须是格式正确的 XML 分析实体。Data must be a well-formed XML parsed entity.| 到。 to .| |必须对 DTD 验证数据。Data must be validated against a DTD.| 至 to
到。 to .| |必须针对 XML 架构验证数据。Data must be validated against an XML schema.| 至 to
到用于进行验证。 to the to use for validation. 请注意，不支持 XML 数据简化 (XDR) 架构验证。Note that doesn't support XML-Data Reduced (XDR) schema validation.| |必须针对内联 XML 架构验证数据。Data must be validated against an inline XML schema.| 至 to
到。 to .| |类型支持。Type support.| 至 to
到使用。 to the to use.| 不支持 XML 数据简化 (XDR) 架构验证。 doesn't support XML-Data Reduced (XDR) schema validation. ## 异步编程Asynchronous programming 在同步模式下，方法从文件、 流或文本读取器的缓冲区中读取第一个区块的数据。In synchronous mode, the method reads the first chunk of data from the buffer of the file, stream, or text reader. 如果某个 I/O 操作失败，这可能会引发异常。This may throw an exception if an I/O operation fails. 在异步模式下，第一次的 I/O 操作会出现一个读取操作，因此读取的操作发生时，将引发产生异常。In asynchronous mode, the first I/O operation occurs with a read operation, so exceptions that arise will be thrown when the read operation occurs. ## 安全注意事项Security considerations 默认情况下，使用没有用户凭据以打开资源的对象。By default, the uses an object with no user credentials to open resources. 这意味着，默认情况下，XML 读取器可以访问不需要凭据的任何位置。This means that, by default, the XML reader can access any location that doesn't require credentials. 使用属性来控制对资源的访问：Use the property to control access to resources: - 设置到对象来限制 XML 读取器可以访问的资源。Set to an object to restrict the resources that the XML reader can access. 或-or- - 设置到`null`以防止 XML 读取器打开任何外部资源。Set to `null` to prevent the XML reader from opening any external resources. ## Examples 此示例创建的 XML 读取器去除无关紧要的空白区域，去除注释，并执行片段级别的一致性检查。This example creates an XML reader that strips insignificant white space, strips comments, and performs fragment-level conformance checking. [!code-csharp[XmlReader.Create#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/CS/XmlReader_Create.cs#11)] [!code-vb[XmlReader.Create#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/VB/XmlReader_Create.vb#11)] 下面的示例使用使用默认凭据来访问的文件。The following example uses an with default credentials to access a file. [!code-cpp[XmlReaderSettings.cctor#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderSettings.cctor/CPP/XmlReaderSettings.cctor.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[XmlReaderSettings.cctor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderSettings.cctor/CS/factory_rdr_cctor2.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderSettings.cctor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderSettings.cctor/VB/factory_rdr_cctor2.vb#1)] [!code-cpp[XmlReaderSettings.cctor#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderSettings.cctor/CPP/XmlReaderSettings.cctor.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[XmlReaderSettings.cctor#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderSettings.cctor/CS/factory_rdr_cctor2.cs#2)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderSettings.cctor#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderSettings.cctor/VB/factory_rdr_cctor2.vb#2)] 下面的代码包装内其他读取器的读取器实例。The following code wraps a reader instance within another reader. [!code-csharp[XmlReader.Create#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/CS/XmlReader_Create.cs#13)] [!code-vb[XmlReader.Create#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/VB/XmlReader_Create.vb#13)] 此示例链接读取器可以添加 DTD 和 XML 架构验证。This example chains readers to add DTD and XML schema validation. [!code-csharp[XmlReader.Create#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/CS/XmlReader_Create.cs#12)] [!code-vb[XmlReader.Create#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.Create/VB/XmlReader_Create.vb#12)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对象使用默认设置用于创建读取器。An object with default settings is used to create the reader. 如果你想要指定要在创建读取器上支持的功能，请使用采用的重载对象作为一个其自变量，并传入具有正确设置的对象。If you wish to specify the features to support on the created reader, use the overload that takes an object as one of its arguments, and pass in an object with the correct settings. 默认不使用凭据用于访问任何外部资源，如文档类型定义 (DTD)、 实体、 架构和等等。A default with no credentials is used to access any external resources such as a document type definition (DTD), entities, schemas, and so on. > [!IMPORTANT] > 从.NET Framework 4.5.2，无默认值开始提供。Starting with the .NET Framework 4.5.2, no default is provided. 如果你的解决方案面向.NET Framework 4.5.2 或更高版本，指定使用属性。If your solution targets the .NET Framework 4.5.2 or later versions, specify an using the property. 如果需要身份验证的网络资源位于外部的资源，则指定使用必要的凭据使用属性。If the external resource is located on a network resource that requires authentication, specify an with the necessary credentials using the property. 创建对象扩展实体引用，并执行的新行字符的 XML 规范化。The created object expands entity references and performs XML normalization of new line characters. ## Examples 下面的示例创建从读取的对象。The following example creates an object that reads from a . remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下不使用凭据用于访问任何外部资源，如文档类型定义 (DTD)、 实体、 架构和等等。By default an with no credentials is used to access any external resources such as a document type definition (DTD), entities, schemas, and so on. > [!IMPORTANT] > 从.NET Framework 4.5.2，无默认值开始提供。Starting with the .NET Framework 4.5.2, no default is provided. 如果你的解决方案面向.NET Framework 4.5.2 或更高版本，指定使用属性。If your solution targets the .NET Framework 4.5.2 or later versions, specify an using the property. 这意味着，可以访问任何不需要身份验证的位置。This means that the can access any locations that does not require authentication. 如果需要身份验证的网络资源位于外部的资源，则使用属性指定使用必要的凭据。If the external resource is located on a network resource that requires authentication, use the property to specify an with the necessary credentials. > [!IMPORTANT] > 你可以限制的资源，可以访问通过设置属性对象。You can restrict the resources that the can access by setting the property to an object. 创建对象扩展实体引用，并执行的新行字符的 XML 规范化。The created object expands entity references and performs XML normalization of new line characters. ## Examples 下面的示例创建支持文档类型定义 (DTD) 验证的对象。The following example creates an object that supports document type definition (DTD) validation. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法允许将其他功能添加到基础对象。This method allows you add additional features to an underlying object. 基础对象可以是另一个创建对象方法，或对象使用的一个具体创建实现。The underlying object can be another object created by the method, or an object created using one of the concrete implementations. 默认不使用凭据用于访问任何外部资源如架构。A default with no credentials is used to access any external resources such as a schema. > [!IMPORTANT] > 从.NET Framework 4.5.2，无默认值开始提供。Starting with the .NET Framework 4.5.2, no default is provided. 如果你的解决方案面向.NET Framework 4.5.2 或更高版本，指定使用属性。If your solution targets the .NET Framework 4.5.2 or later versions, specify an using the property. 如果需要身份验证的网络资源位于外部的资源，则指定使用必要的凭据使用属性。If the external resource is located on a network resource that requires authentication, specify an with the necessary credentials using the property. > [!IMPORTANT] > 可以使用以下方法之一来控制哪些资源可以访问：You can use one of the following methods to control which resources the can access: > > - 通过将 属性设置为 对象限制 可访问的资源。Restrict the resources that the can access by setting the property to an object. > > 或-or- > > - 通过将 属性设置为 ，不允许 `null` 打开任何外部资源。Do not allow the to open any external resources by setting the property to `null`. 创建对象扩展实体引用，并执行的新行字符的 XML 规范化。The created object expands entity references and performs XML normalization of new line characters. ## Examples 下面的示例创建一个验证包装在周围的对象对象。The following example creates a validating object that is wrapped around an object. remarks.format: ## Remarks 下面的 XML 包含特定的命名空间中的属性：The following XML contains an attribute in a specific namespace: ``` ``` 你可以查找`dt:type`属性使用一个自变量 （前缀和本地名称） 或两个自变量 （本地名称和命名空间 URI）：You can lookup the `dt:type` attribute using one argument (prefix and local name) or two arguments (local name and namespace URI): ``` String dt = reader.GetAttribute("dt:type"); String dt2 = reader.GetAttribute("type","urn:datatypes"); ``` 查找`xmlns:dt`特性，请使用以下参数之一：To lookup the `xmlns:dt` attribute, use one of the following arguments: ``` String dt3 = reader.GetAttribute("xmlns:dt"); String dt4 = reader.GetAttribute("dt",http://www.w3.org/2000/xmlns/); ``` 你还可以获得此信息使用属性。You can also get this information using the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 下表列出具有要返回的值的节点类型。The following table lists node types that have a value to return. |节点类型Node Type|“值”Value| |---------------|-----------| |`Attribute`|属性的值。The value of the attribute.| |`CDATA`|CDATA 节的内容。The content of the CDATA section.| |`Comment`|注释的内容。The content of the comment.| |`DocumentType`|内部子集。The internal subset.| |`ProcessingInstruction`|全部内容（不包括指令目标）。The entire content, excluding the target.| |`SignificantWhitespace`|混合内容模型中标记之间的空白。The white space between markup in a mixed content model.| |`Text`|文本节点的内容。The content of the text node.| |`Whitespace`|标记之间的空白。The white space between markup.| |`XmlDeclaration`|声明的内容。The content of the declaration.| ## Examples 请参阅(在`XmlTextReader`类) 使用此方法的示例。See (in the `XmlTextReader` class) for a sample using this method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性使您能够确定下面各项之间的差异：This property enables you to determine the difference between the following: `` (`IsEmptyElement`是`true`)。`` (`IsEmptyElement` is `true`). `` (`IsEmptyElement`是`false`，尽管元素内容为空)。`` (`IsEmptyElement` is `false`, although element content is empty). 相应`EndElement`节点不为空的元素生成。A corresponding `EndElement` node is not generated for empty elements. 如果已将默认内容添加到架构验证来说，由于元素`IsEmptyElement`仍会返回`true`。If default content has been added to an element due to schema validation, `IsEmptyElement` still returns `true`. 它没有任何影响在该元素具有默认值。It has no bearing on whether or not the element has a default value. 换而言之，`IsEmptyElement`仅报告是否与源文档中的元素具有结束元素标记。In other words, `IsEmptyElement` simply reports whether or not the element in the source document had an end element tag. ## Examples 下面的示例显示了每个元素的文本内容。The following example displays the text content of each element. [!code-csharp[XmlReaderBasic#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/CS/XmlReader_Basic.cs#10)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderBasic#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/VB/xmlreader_basic.vb#10)] 该示例使用文件，`elems.xml`作为输入。The example uses the file, `elems.xml`, as input. span.span: The enabling you to get the atomized version of a string within the node.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 从返回的所有节点和属性名称使用原子化`NameTable`。All node and attribute names returned from are atomized using the `NameTable`. 当多次返回相同的名称 (例如， `Customer`)，然后相同`String`为该名称将返回的对象。When the same name is returned multiple times (for example, `Customer`), then the same `String` object will be returned for that name. 这使您可以编写高效的代码，未对象上而不是昂贵的字符串比较这些字符串的比较。This makes it possible for you to write efficient code that does object comparisons on these strings instead of expensive string comparisons.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当是首次创建和初始化，没有可用信息。When an is first created and initialized, there is no information available. 必须调用读取的第一个节点。You must call to read the first node. 方法设置要启动的 XML 读取器的状态遍历 XML 文件按顺序直至其达到的文件，此时该方法返回的值的末尾`false`。The method sets the state of the XML reader to initiate and moves through the XML file sequentially until it reaches the end of the file, at which point the method returns a value of `false`. 此方法需要至少四个字节从数据流才能开始分析。This method requires at least four bytes from the data stream in order to begin parsing. 如果返回少于四个字节，并且在流中没有更多的数据，该方法返回`false`。If fewer than four bytes are returned and there is no more data in the stream, the method returns `false`. 如果在流中没有更多的数据，该方法将阻止分析直到收到的第四个字节。If there is more data in the stream, the method will block parsing until receipt of the fourth byte. 此方法的异步版本，请参阅。For the asynchronous version of this method, see . ## Examples 下面的示例读取 XML 文件，并显示每个节点。The following example reads an XML file and displays each of the nodes. [!code-csharp[XmlReaderBasic#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/CS/XmlReader_Basic.cs#8)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderBasic#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/VB/xmlreader_basic.vb#8)] 此示例使用`items.xml`文件。The sample uses the `items.xml` file. [!code-xml[XML_Core_Files#2](~/samples/snippets/xml/VS_Snippets_Data/XML_Core_Files/XML/items.xml#2)] **输出：****Output:** ``` Test with an entity: 123Test with a child element stuffTest with a CDATA section ]]> defTest with a char entity: A1234567890ABCD ```

summary.span: 将内容作为指定类型的对象读取。

span.span: Reads the content as an object of the type specified.

returns.span: 已转换为请求类型的串联文本内容或属性值。

span.span: The concatenated text content or attribute value converted to the requested type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 此方法读取读取器当前位置的文本内容，并将其转换为所请求的返回类型。This method reads the text content at the current reader position and converts it to the requested return type. 文本、空白、有效空白和 CDATA 节串联在一起。Text, white space, significant white space and CDATA sections are concatenated. 跳过注释和处理指令，并自动解析实体引用。Comments and processing instructions are skipped and entity references are automatically resolved. 此方法用于读取、 将转换如有必要，以及返回当前节点中的原子值项内容。This method is used to read, convert if necessary, and return atomic value items from the current node content. 返回输入的类型是否为有效的映射的当前节点然后包含当前节点的值的目标类型的实例的类型。If the input type is a valid mappings for the type of the current node then an instance of the target type containing the value of the current node is returned. 请参阅备注部分中的referencepage 有关默认映射的列表。See the Remarks section in the referencepage for a list of the default mappings. 例如，如果你有以下 XML 文本：For example, if you had the following XML text: ``` 123 456 ``` 如果数据类型化和一个字符串数组，提供给从根据有效的 CLR 类型映射的列表的字符串转换方法调用，则整数值。If the data is typed and a string array is supplied to the method call, then the integer values are converted from strings according to the list of valid CLR type mappings. 如果数据将非类型化，并且一个字符串数组，提供给方法调用，则内容将被分析为单独的字符串。If the data is untyped and a string array is supplied to the method call, then the content is parsed into separate strings. 包含两个字符串的数组被返回"123"和"456"的值。An array containing two strings is returned with the values "123" and "456". 从内容不保留空格。The spaces are not preserved from the content. 通常在读取非类型化的数据的内容被分析根据所提供的类型。In general when reading untyped data the content is parsed according to the supplied type. 例如，如果一个整数数组提供给方法调用，则字符串解析为整数 的数组。For example, if an integer array is supplied to the method call then the string is parsed into an array of integers {123,456}. 在下面的示例 XML 文本不是由空格分隔In the following example the XML text is not separated by spaces ``` 123456789 ``` 如果有非类型化的内容和一个字符串数组，提供给方法然后调用包含一个具有值"123456789"返回串联的字符串的数组。If the content is untyped and a string array is supplied to the method call then an array containing one concatenated string is returned with the value "123456789". 下表描述了此方法如何处理每个节点类型。The following table describes how this method treats each node type. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|返回值Return value|读取器行为Reader behavior| |-----------------|------------------|---------------------| |`Text`

`CDATA`

`Whitespace`

`SignificantWhitespace`

`EntityReference`

`EndEntity`|将文本、CDATA、空白和有效空白节点的串联内容转换为所请求的类型。Concatenated content of text, CDATA, white space and significant white space nodes converted to the requested type.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`Attribute`|与调用相同`XmlConvert.ToXxx`上属性值。Same as calling `XmlConvert.ToXxx` on the attribute value.|读取器仍保留在当前位置。The reader remains in the current position.| |`Comment`

`ProcessingInstruction`|忽略处理指令 (PI) 或注释，读取 PI 或注释后面的串联文本内容。Ignores the processing instruction (PI) or comment and reads the concatenated text content that follows the PI or comment.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`EndElement`|空字符串。An empty string.|读取器仍保留在当前位置。The reader remains in the current position.| |`Element`

`XmlDeclaration`

`None`

`Document`

`DocumentType`

`Notation`

`Entity`

`DocumentFragment`|引发 。An is thrown.|未定义，尽管通常读取器将保留在当前位置。Undefined, although typically the reader remains in the current position.| 有关详细信息，请参阅备注部分的引用页和[W3C XML 架构第 2 部分： 数据类型](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page and the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 此方法的异步版本，请参阅。For the asynchronous version of this method, see . ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法以返回到字符串对象的数组的颜色元素的内容。The following example uses the method to return the contents of the colors element into an array of string objects. [!code-csharp[XmlReader.ReadContentAs#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadContentAs/CS/readContentAs.cs#2)] [!code-vb[XmlReader.ReadContentAs#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadContentAs/VB/readContentAs.vb#2)] 示例使用 `dataFile_2.xml` 文件作为输入。The example uses the `dataFile_2.xml` file as input. [!code-xml[XmlReader.ReadContentAs#3](~/samples/snippets/xml/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadContentAs/XML/dataFile_2.xml#3)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法的内容流式处理，将解码`Base64`内容，并返回已解码的二进制字节 (例如，内联`Base64`编码的 GIF 图像) 到缓冲区。This method streams the content, decodes the `Base64` content, and returns the decoded binary bytes (for example, an inline `Base64` encoded GIF image) into the buffer. 可以连续调用此方法，以读取大的嵌入文本流。This method can be called successively to read large streams of embedded text. 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 1521"MIME （多用途 Internet 邮件扩展） 部分一个： 机制来指定以及描述 Internet 消息正文的格式"。For more information, see RFC 1521, "MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) Part One: Mechanisms for Specifying and Describing the Format of Internet Message Bodies". 你可以获取从 Rfc[征求意见文档网站](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=37119)。You can obtain RFCs from the [Request for Comments Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=37119). > [!NOTE] > 不应访问的任何读取器属性之间调用方法，直到该方法返回值`0`。You should not access any of the reader properties between calls to the method until the method returns the value `0`. 此方法具有以下行为：This method has the following behavior: - 返回的值`0`时它已达到它正在操作的字节流的末尾。 returns the value `0` when it has reached the end of the byte stream it was operating on. 读取器定位在的第一个非内容节点上。The reader is positioned on the first non-content node. - 如果您要求更少，或的字节数比流读取器将保留在当前位置中剩余的精确数目。If you ask for fewer, or the exact number of, bytes than are left in the stream the reader remains in its current position. - 不支持对以下 XML 节点类型： `Element`， `XmlDeclaration`， `None`， `Document`， `DocumentType`， `Notation`， `Entity`， `DocumentFragment`。 is not supported on the following XML node types: `Element`, `XmlDeclaration`, `None`, `Document`, `DocumentType`, `Notation`, `Entity`, `DocumentFragment`. 此方法的异步版本，请参阅。For the asynchronous version of this method, see .

summary.span: 将当前位置的文本内容作为 读取。

span.span: Reads the text content at the current position as a .

returns.span: 作为 对象的文本内容。

span.span: The text content as a object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 此方法将文本、 空白、 有效空白和 CDATA 节连接在一起，并跳过任何注释或处理指令。This method concatenates text, white space, significant white space, and CDATA sections, and skips any comments or processing instructions. 实体引用将自动解决。Entity references are automatically resolved. 如果内容类型`xsd:boolean`，则读取器返回取消装箱对象。If the content is typed `xsd:boolean`, the reader returns an unboxed object. 如果内容未类型化`xsd:boolean`，读取器将尝试将其转换为根据定义的规则的对象[W3C XML 架构第 2 部分： 数据类型](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议。If the content is not typed `xsd:boolean`, the reader attempts to convert it to a object according to the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 下表描述了此方法如何处理每个节点类型。The following table describes how this method treats each node type. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|返回值Return value|读取器行为Reader behavior| |-----------------|------------------|---------------------| |`Text`

`CDATA`

`Whitespace`

`SignificantWhitespace`

`EntityReference`

`EndEntity`|将文本、CDATA、空白和有效空白节点的串联内容转换为所请求的类型。Concatenated content of text, CDATA, white space and significant white space nodes converted to the requested type.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`Attribute`|与调用相同`XmlConvert.ToXxx`上属性值。Same as calling `XmlConvert.ToXxx` on the attribute value.|读取器仍保留在当前位置。The reader remains in the current position.| |`Comment`

`ProcessingInstruction`|忽略处理指令 (PI) 或注释，读取 PI 或注释后面的串联文本内容。Ignores the processing instruction (PI) or comment and reads the concatenated text content that follows the PI or comment.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`EndElement`|空字符串。An empty string.|读取器仍保留在当前位置。The reader remains in the current position.| |`Element`

`XmlDeclaration`

`None`

`Document`

`DocumentType`

`Notation`

`Entity`

`DocumentFragment`|引发 。An is thrown.|未定义，尽管通常读取器将保留在当前位置。Undefined, although typically the reader remains in the current position.| 有关详细信息，请参阅引用页和[W3C XML 架构第 2 部分： 数据类型](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议。For more information, see the reference page and the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法来读取特性作为 B`oolean`值。The following example uses the method to read the attribute as a B`oolean` value. [!code-csharp[XmlReader.ReadContentAs#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadContentAs/CS/readContentAs.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlReader.ReadContentAs#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadContentAs/VB/readContentAs.vb#1)] 示例使用 `dataFile_2.xml` 文件作为输入。The example uses the `dataFile_2.xml` file as input. [!code-xml[XmlReader.ReadContentAs#3](~/samples/snippets/xml/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadContentAs/XML/dataFile_2.xml#3)]

`DocumentFragment`|引发 。An is thrown.|未定义，尽管通常读取器将保留在当前位置。Undefined, although typically the reader remains in the current position.| 有关详细信息，请参阅引用页和[W3C XML 架构第 2 部分： 数据类型](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议。For more information, see the reference page and the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation.

summary.span: 将当前位置的文本内容作为双精度浮点数读取。

span.span: Reads the text content at the current position as a double-precision floating-point number.

returns.span: 作为双精度浮点数的文本内容。

span.span: The text content as a double-precision floating-point number.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 此方法将文本、 空白、 有效空白和 CDATA 节连接在一起，并跳过任何注释或处理指令。This method concatenates text, white space, significant white space, and CDATA sections, and skips any comments or processing instructions. 实体引用将自动解决。Entity references are automatically resolved. 如果内容类型`xsd:double`，则读取器返回的双精度浮点数。If the content is typed `xsd:double`, the reader returns a double-precision floating-point number. 如果内容未类型化`xsd:double`，读取器将尝试将其转换为双精度浮点数，根据定义的规则[W3C XML 架构第 2 部分： 数据类型](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议。If the content is not typed `xsd:double`, the reader attempts to convert it to a double-precision floating-point number according to the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 下表描述了此方法如何处理每个节点类型。The following table describes how this method treats each node type. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|返回值Return value|读取器行为Reader behavior| |-----------------|------------------|---------------------| |`Text`

`CDATA`

`Whitespace`

`SignificantWhitespace`

`EntityReference`

`EndEntity`|将文本、CDATA、空白和有效空白节点的串联内容转换为所请求的类型。Concatenated content of text, CDATA, white space and significant white space nodes converted to the requested type.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`Attribute`|与调用相同`XmlConvert.ToXxx`上属性值。Same as calling `XmlConvert.ToXxx` on the attribute value.|读取器仍保留在当前位置。The reader remains in the current position.| |`Comment`

`ProcessingInstruction`|忽略处理指令 (PI) 或注释，读取 PI 或注释后面的串联文本内容。Ignores the processing instruction (PI) or comment and reads the concatenated text content that follows the PI or comment.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`EndElement`|空字符串。An empty string.|读取器仍保留在当前位置。The reader remains in the current position.| |`Element`

`XmlDeclaration`

`None`

`Document`

`DocumentType`

`Notation`

`Entity`

`DocumentFragment`|引发 。An is thrown.|未定义，尽管通常读取器将保留在当前位置。Undefined, although typically the reader remains in the current position.| 有关详细信息，请参阅引用页和[W3C XML 架构第 2 部分： 数据类型](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议。For more information, see the reference page and the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation.

summary.span: 将当前位置的文本内容作为 读取。

remarks.format:
## Remarks 此方法将文本、 空白、 有效空白和 CDATA 节连接在一起，并跳过任何注释或处理指令。This method concatenates text, white space, significant white space, and CDATA sections, and skips any comments or processing instructions. 实体引用将自动解决。Entity references are automatically resolved. 如果内容类型，则读取器返回由指定的最适当类型的装箱的 CLR属性。If the content is typed, the reader returns a boxed CLR of the most appropriate type, specified by the property. 如果内容是列表类型，则读取器返回适当类型的装箱对象的数组。If the content is a list type, the reader returns an array of boxed objects of the appropriate type. > [!NOTE] > 如果出现验证错误时分析内容时，读卡器创建对象方法，则读取器返回作为字符串的内容。If a validation error occurs while parsing the content and the reader is an object created by the method, the reader returns the content as a string. 换而言之验证错误或警告时，内容被视为非类型化。In other words when a validation error or warning occurs, the content is considered to be untyped. 如果内容未类型化，读取器将以字符串的形式返回内容。If the content is not typed, the reader returns the content as a string. 下表描述了此方法如何处理每个节点类型。The following table describes how this method treats each node type. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|返回值Return value|读取器行为Reader behavior| |-----------------|------------------|---------------------| |`Text`

`CDATA`

`Whitespace`

`SignificantWhitespace`

`EntityReference`

`EndEntity`|将文本、CDATA、空白和有效空白节点的串联内容转换为所请求的类型。Concatenated content of text, CDATA, white space and significant white space nodes converted to the requested type.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`Attribute`|与调用相同`XmlConvert.ToXxx`上属性值。Same as calling `XmlConvert.ToXxx` on the attribute value.|读取器将保留在当前位置The reader remains in the current position| |`Comment`

`ProcessingInstruction`|忽略处理指令 (PI) 或注释，读取 PI 或注释后面的串联文本内容。Ignores the processing instruction (PI) or comment and reads the concatenated text content that follows the PI or comment.|移至下一个开始元素或结束元素标记。Moves to the next start element or end element tag. 实体引用自动展开。Entity references are automatically expanded.| |`EndElement`|如果读取器验证读取器的架构元素的值 (设置为); 否则为空字符串。The value of the element if the reader is a schema validating reader ( is set to ); otherwise an empty string.|读取器仍保留在当前位置。The reader remains in the current position.| |`Element`

`XmlDeclaration`

`None`

`Document`

`DocumentType`

`Notation`

`Entity`

`DocumentFragment`|引发 。An is thrown.|未定义，尽管通常读取器将保留在当前位置。Undefined, although typically the reader remains in the current position.| 有关详细信息，请参阅备注部分的引用页和[W3C XML 架构第 2 部分： 数据类型](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page and the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 此方法的异步版本，请参阅。For the asynchronous version of this method, see .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法读取开始标记，该元素的内容，并将移过结束元素标记读取器。This method reads the start tag, the contents of the element, and moves the reader past the end element tag. 扩展实体并将忽略处理指令和注释。It expands entities and ignores processing instructions and comments. 元素只能包含简单内容。The element can only contain simple content. 也就是说，它不能有子元素。That is, it cannot have child elements. 有关详细信息，请参阅备注部分的引用页和[W3C XML 架构第 2 部分： 数据类型](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page and the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 此方法的异步版本，请参阅。For the asynchronous version of this method, see . ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法来读取的内容`date`节点。The following example uses the method to read the content of the `date` node. [!code-csharp[XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs/CS/readElementContentAs.cs#5)] [!code-vb[XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader.ReadElementContentAs/VB/readElementContentAs.vb#5)] 示例使用 `dataFile.xml` 文件作为输入。The example uses the `dataFile.xml` file as input. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法读取元素内容，将使用其解码`Base64`编码，并返回已解码的二进制字节 (例如，内联`Base64`-编码的 GIF 图像) 到缓冲区。This method reads the element content, decodes it using `Base64` encoding, and returns the decoded binary bytes (for example, an inline `Base64`-encoded GIF image) into the buffer. 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 1521"MIME （多用途 Internet 邮件扩展） 部分一个： 机制来指定以及描述 Internet 消息正文的格式"。For more information, see RFC 1521, "MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) Part One: Mechanisms for Specifying and Describing the Format of Internet Message Bodies". 你可以获取从 Rfc[征求意见文档网站](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=37119)。You can obtain RFCs from the [Request for Comments Web site](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=37119). 只能读取简单内容元素。 can only read simple-content elements. 该元素可以包含文本、 空白、 有效空白、 CDATA 节、 注释和处理指令。The element can contain text, white space, significant white space, CDATA sections, comments and processing instructions. 它还可以包含实体引用自动展开。It can also contain entity references, which are automatically expanded. 元素不能有子元素。The element cannot have child elements. 此方法是非常类似于方法，但它只能在元素节点类型上调用。This method is very similar to the method except that it can only be called on element node types. 如果`count`值高于在文档中，字节数是否等于在文档中，字节数或读取文档中的所有剩余字节，并返回读取的字节数。If the `count` value is higher than the number of bytes in the document, or if it is equal to the number of bytes in the document, the reads all the remaining bytes in the document and returns the number of bytes read. 下一步方法调用将返回零，并将读取器移动到节点以下`EndElement`。The next method call returns a zero and moves the reader to the node following the `EndElement`. 如果调用消耗了全部元素内容时之前，读取器的行为类似于第一个内容已被用尽，然后调用了方法。If you call before all of the element content is consumed, the reader may behave as if the first content was consumed and then the method was called. 这意味着读取器将读取的所有文本，直到遇到 end 元素。This means that the reader will read all the text until the end element is encountered. 然后，它将读取结束标记节点、 读取下一个节点，然后将自身定位在下一步的后续节点。It will then read the end tag node, read the next node, and then position itself on the next subsequent node. 此方法的异步版本，请参阅。For the asynchronous version of this method, see . ## Examples 下面的示例读取一个内联`Base64`编码的图像。The following example reads an inline `Base64` encoded image. `Base64`数据嵌入在``元素。The `Base64` data is embedded within the `` element. A用于创建新的二进制数据文件。A is used to create a new binary data file. [!code-csharp[XmlReader_Read_Write_Binary#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader_Read_Write_Binary/CS/readBinary.cs#4)] [!code-vb[XmlReader_Read_Write_Binary#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReader_Read_Write_Binary/VB/readBinary.vb#4)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法读取开始标记，该元素的内容，并将移过结束元素标记读取器。This method reads the start tag, the contents of the element, and moves the reader past the end element tag. 扩展实体并将忽略处理指令和注释。It expands entities and ignores processing instructions and comments. 元素只能包含简单内容。The element can only contain simple content. 也就是说，它不能有子元素。That is, it cannot have child elements. 如果指定类型的元素内容`xsd:boolean`，则读取器返回取消装箱对象。If the element content is typed `xsd:boolean`, the reader returns an unboxed object. 如果内容未类型化`xsd:boolean`，读取器将尝试将其转换为根据定义的规则的对象[W3C XML 架构第 2 部分： 数据类型](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议。If the content is not typed `xsd:boolean`, the reader attempts to convert it to a object according to the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 有关详细信息，请参阅 引用页的“备注”部分。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法读取开始标记，该元素的内容，并将移过结束元素标记读取器。This method reads the start tag, the contents of the element, and moves the reader past the end element tag. 扩展实体并将忽略处理指令和注释。It expands entities and ignores processing instructions and comments. 元素只能包含简单内容。The element can only contain simple content. 也就是说，它不能有子元素。That is, it cannot have child elements. 如果内容类型`xsd:dateTime`，则读取器返回取消装箱对象。If the content is typed `xsd:dateTime`, the reader returns an unboxed object. 如果内容未类型化`xsd:dateTime`，读取器将尝试将其转换为根据定义的规则的对象[W3C XML 架构第 2 部分： 数据类型](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议。If the content is not typed `xsd:dateTime`, the reader attempts to convert it to a object according to the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. > [!NOTE] > 如果内容类型化为 ，则不能使用 `xsd:gMonthDay` 值。You cannot rely on the value when the content is typed as `xsd:gMonthDay`. 始终设置在这种情况下为 1904年值。 always sets the value to 1904 in this case. 有关详细信息，请参阅 引用页的“备注”部分。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page. ## Examples 下面的示例使用方法来读取的内容`date`元素。The following example uses the method to read the content of the `date` element. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法读取开始标记，该元素的内容，并将移过结束元素标记读取器。This method reads the start tag, the contents of the element, and moves the reader past the end element tag. 扩展实体并将忽略处理指令和注释。It expands entities and ignores processing instructions and comments. 元素只能包含简单内容。The element can only contain simple content. 也就是说，它不能有子元素。That is, it cannot have child elements. 如果内容类型`xsd:double`，则读取器返回的双精度浮点数。If the content is typed `xsd:double`, the reader returns a double-precision floating-point number. 如果内容未类型化`xsd:double`，读取器将尝试将其转换为双精度浮点数，根据定义的规则[W3C XML 架构第 2 部分： 数据类型](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871)建议。If the content is not typed `xsd:double`, the reader attempts to convert it to a double-precision floating-point number according to the rules defined by the [W3C XML Schema Part 2: Datatypes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=4871) recommendation. 有关详细信息，请参阅 引用页的“备注”部分。For more information, see the Remarks section of the reference page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法返回当前节点包括的标记中的所有内容。This method returns all the content of the current node including the markup. 不返回当前节点（开始标记）和对应的结束节点（结束标记）。The current node (start tag) and corresponding end node (end tag) are not returned. 例如，如果你有以下：For example, if you had the following: ``` this ``` `ReadInnerXml` 返回 `this ``ReadInnerXml` returns `this ` 此方法可按以下方式处理元素和属性节点：This method handles element and attribute nodes in the following manner: |节点类型Node type|调用前的位置Position before the call|XML 片断XML fragment|返回值Return value|在调用后的位置Position after the call| |---------------|------------------------------|------------------|------------------|-----------------------------| |`Element`|在 `item1` 开始标记上。On the `item1` start tag.|\text1\\text2\\text1\\text2\|text1text1|在 `item2` 开始标记上。On the `item2` start tag.| |`Attribute`|在 `attr1` 属性节点上。On the `attr1` attribute node.|\text\\text\|val1val1|保留在 `attr1` 属性节点上。Remains on the `attr1` attribute node.| 如果读取器定位在叶节点上，则调用 `ReadInnerXml` 等效于调用 。If the reader is positioned on a leaf node, calling `ReadInnerXml` is equivalent to calling . 该方法返回`String.Empty`（特性节点除外，在这种情况下返回的属性的值）。The method returns `String.Empty` (except for attribute nodes, in which case the value of the attribute is returned). 此方法会检查格式正确的 XML。This method checks for well-formed XML. 如果`ReadInnerXml`从调用，此方法还将验证返回的内容。If `ReadInnerXml` is called from an , this method also validates the content returned. 在中实现，和`XmlValidatingReader`类`ReadOuterXml`方法可以识别命名空间。As implemented in the , and `XmlValidatingReader` classes the `ReadOuterXml` method is namespace aware. 此方法的异步版本，请参阅。For the asynchronous version of this method, see . ## Examples 下面的示例比较`ReadInnerXml`和方法。The following example compares the `ReadInnerXml` and methods. [!code-csharp[XmlReaderBasic#12](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/CS/XmlReader_Basic.cs#12)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderBasic#12](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/VB/xmlreader_basic.vb#12)] 该示例使用`2books.xml`文件作为输入。The example uses `2books.xml` file as input. remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法类似于是但它还返回的开始和结束标记。This method is similar to except it also returns the start and end tags. 此方法可按以下方式处理元素和属性节点：This method handles element and attribute nodes in the following manner: |节点类型Node type|调用前的位置Position before the call|XML 片断XML fragment|返回值Return value|在调用后的位置Position After the Call| |---------------|------------------------------|------------------|------------------|-----------------------------| |`Element`|在 `item1` 开始标记上。On the `item1` start tag.|\text1\\text2\\text1\\text2\|\text1\\text1\|在 `item2` 开始标记上。On the `item2` start tag.| |`Attribute`|在 `attr1` 属性节点上。On the `attr1` attribute node.|\text\\text\|attr1="val1"attr1="val1"|保留在 `attr1` 属性节点上。Remains on the `attr1` attribute node.| 如果读取器定位在叶节点上，则调用 `ReadOuterXml` 等效于调用 。If the reader is positioned on a leaf node, calling `ReadOuterXml` is equivalent to calling . 该方法返回`String.Empty`（特性节点除外，在这种情况下返回的属性标记）。The method returns `String.Empty` (except for attribute nodes, in which case the attribute markup is returned). 此方法会检查格式正确的 XML。This method checks for well-formed XML. 如果`ReadOuterXml`从调用，此方法还将验证返回的内容If `ReadOuterXml` is called from an , this method also validates the content returned 在中实现，和`XmlValidatingReader`类`ReadOuterXml`方法可以识别命名空间。As implemented in the , and `XmlValidatingReader` classes the `ReadOuterXml` method is namespace aware. 给定以下 XML 文本`hello`，如果读取器定位在`S:B`开始标记，`ReadOuterXml`返回`hello`。Given the following XML text `hello`, if the reader were positioned on the `S:B` start tag, `ReadOuterXml` returns `hello`. 此方法的异步版本，请参阅。For the asynchronous version of this method, see . ## Examples 下面的示例比较`ReadInnerXml`和`ReadOuterXml`方法。The following example compares the `ReadInnerXml` and `ReadOuterXml` methods. returns.span: 调用 方法时，会将新的读取器定位在调用 方法之前的当前节点上。

span.span: Calling the method positions the new reader on the node that was current before the call to the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 可以仅在元素节点上调用。 can be called only on element nodes. 当已读取整个子树时，调用到方法返回`false`。When the entire sub-tree has been read, calls to the method returns `false`. 当新的 XML 读取器已关闭，位于原始 readeris`EndElement`节点的子树。When the new XML reader has been closed, the original readeris positioned on the `EndElement` node of the sub-tree. 因此，如果调用未关闭的书籍元素子树已读取和新的 XML 读取器之后开始标记上的方法，原始的 XML 读取器定位在的书籍元素的结束标记。Thus, if you called the method on the start tag of the book element, after the sub-tree has been read and the new XML reader has been closed, the original XML reader is positioned on the end tag of the book element. 在关闭新的读取器之前，不应对原始读取器执行任何操作。You should not perform any operations on the original reader until the new reader has been closed. 不支持此操作，因为这样可能会导致意想不到的行为。This action is not supported and can result in unpredictable behavior. > [!NOTE] > 方法不适用于 creatingcopies 可以独立地使用 XML 数据。The method isn't intended for creatingcopies of the XML data that you can work with independently. 它的 designedto 创建 XML 元素周围的边界。It's designedto create a boundary around an XML element. 如果你想要将数据传递给另一个组件进行处理，你想要限制组件可以访问你数据，这非常有用。This is useful if you want to pass data to another component for processing and you wish to limit how much of your data the component can access. 传递时，返回 XML 读取器给另一个应用程序，应用程序的方法可以访问仅该 XML 元素，不是整个 XML 文档。When you pass an XML reader returned by the method to another application, the application can access only that XML element, not the entire XML document. ## Examples 下面的示例显示如何使用 方法。The following example shows how to use the method. [!code-csharp[XmlReaderBasic#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/CS/XmlReader_Basic.cs#13)] [!code-vb[XmlReaderBasic#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlReaderBasic/VB/xmlreader_basic.vb#13)] 使用下面的 XML 数据，若要运行本主题中的示例：Use the following XML data to run the examples in this topic: ``` A Brief History of Time Principle Of Relativity Victory of Reason The Unicorn that did not Fail Rational Ontology The Meaning of Pizza ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是功能上等效执行`following::name`从当前节点的 XPath 表达式。This method is functionally equivalent executing the `following::name` XPath expression from the current node. 它提供了在 XML 文档中查找命名的元素的快速方法。It provides a quick way to find a named element in the XML document. 将读取器推进到下一步的后续元素，匹配的指定的名称，并返回`true`如果找到了匹配的元素。It advances the reader to the next following element that matches the specified name and returns `true` if a matching element is found. 使用下面的示例中，读取器将读取到指定的元素的第一个实例转发读取时。Using the example below, the reader would read to the first instance of the specified element while reading forward. ```xml ``` ```csharp XmlTextReader reader = newXmlTextReader("sample.xml"); reader.ReadToFollowing("item"); ``` 可以在所有节点类型上调用此方法。This method can be called on all node types.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法是功能上等效执行`following::name`从当前节点的 XPath 表达式。This method is functionally equivalent executing the `following::name` XPath expression from the current node. 它提供了在 XML 文档中查找命名的元素的快速方法。It provides a quick way to find a named element in the XML document. 将读取器推进到下一步的后续元素，匹配的指定的名称，并返回`true`如果找到了匹配的元素。It advances the reader to the next following element that matches the specified name and returns `true` if a matching element is found. ```xml ``` ```csharp XmlTextReader reader = newXmlTextReader("sample.xml"); reader.ReadToFollowing("item", "urn:1"); ``` 可以在所有节点类型上调用此方法。This method can be called on all node types.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法可实现的非常大的流式处理方式，即，XML 文档中嵌入的文本流读取少量的字符而不是为整个值分配单个字符串的一次。This method enables reading of very large streams of text embedded in an XML document in a streaming fashion, that is, a small number of characters at a time instead of allocating a single string for the whole value. 可以具有值的任何节点上调用此方法 (是`true`)，但实际流式处理的节点值仅在文本、 空白和有效空白节点上调用时出现。This method can be called on any node that has a value ( is `true`), however actual streaming of the node value only occurs when called on a text, white space and significant white space nodes. 其他节点类型值进行缓存，包括属性和 CDATA 节点。Other node type values are cached, including attributes and CDATA nodes. 此方法返回的内容属性并不会移动。This method returns only the content of the property and does not move the . 此方法读取指定的数目的字符 (`count`) 到字符缓冲区中的节点值 (`buffer`) 指定偏移量 (`index`) 并返回写入到缓冲区的字符数。This method reads the specified number of characters (`count`) of the node value into a character buffer (`buffer`) at a specified offset (`index`) and returns the number of characters written to the buffer. 它将返回`0`时它已达到值的末尾。It returns the `0` when it has reached the end of the value. 它不能重新启动才能再次读取该值。It cannot be restarted to read through the value again. 对的调用之间属性不会更改除属性。In between calls to the properties do no change except for the property. 当访问属性时它也可能返回的部分值 (带有尚未返回的字符) 或全部值，具体取决于实现。When the property is accessed it may either return a partial value (with characters not yet returned by ) or a full value depending on the implementation. 所有中的实现命名空间部分为返回值属性实现。All the implementations in the namespace return a partial value for the property implementation. 任何 Read 方法可以调用之间调用。Any Read method can be called in between calls to . 如果发生这种情况，移动到下流和尚不返回任何字符中将跳过。If this occurs, the moves to the next in the stream and any characters not yet returned are skipped. 可能有一种情况时返回请求的字符数小于。There may be a case when returns less than the requested number of characters. 例如，如果在位置 127 和 128 使用代理项对有 200 个字符长整型值，你调用与 128 个字符的缓冲区，该方法调用将返回而不是请求 128 127 个字符。For example, if you had a 200-character long value with a surrogate pair at positions 127 and 128 and you called with a 128-character buffer, the method call would return 127 characters instead of the requested 128. 则将在下一步中返回的代理项对调用。The surrogate pair would then be returned in the next call. 在这种情况下，未返回请求的 128 个字符，因为这样做因此将会造成缓冲区末尾的不完整的代理项对。In this case, did not return the requested 128 characters because doing so would have resulted in an incomplete surrogate pair at the end of the buffer. 此方法的异步版本，请参阅。For the asynchronous version of this method, see .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 请参阅[System.Xml 类中的类型支持](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md)有关默认映射的列表。See [Type Support in the System.Xml Classes](~/docs/standard/data/xml/type-support-in-the-system-xml-classes.md) for a list of the default mappings. 类型的元素`xs:int`具有`ValueType`的`System.Int32`默认情况下。An element of type `xs:int` has a `ValueType` of `System.Int32` by default. 但是，`ValueType`可能是一种有效类型可以映射到`xs:int`，如`System.Int16`或`System.Double`。However, the `ValueType` could be one of the valid types that can be mapped to `xs:int`, such as `System.Int16` or `System.Double`. 如果节点为非类型化，或如果该节点是包含混合的内容的元素，节点值映射到`System.String`类型。If a node is un-typed, or if the node is an element that contains mixed content, the node value is mapped to the `System.String` type.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性表示`xml:lang`中当前节点所在作用域。This property represents the `xml:lang` scope within which the current node resides. 例如，下面是与 XML 片段`xml:lang`设置为英语 （美国） 的根元素中：For example, here is an XML fragment with `xml:lang` set to US English in the root element: ``` Fred ``` 当读取器定位在`name`元素，你可以使用此属性来发现它是否在美国英语的作用域`xml:lang`属性。When the reader is positioned on the `name` element, you can use this property to find that it is in the scope of a US English `xml:lang` attribute. ## Examples 请参阅有关使用此属性的示例。See for an example of using this property.
